slide.content: CDC recommends contacting state and local health departments to find out what the testing guidelines and procedures are for their specific area. Depending on the situation in the local area, testing procedure may deviate from the recommended CDC guideline. Clinical judgement should be exercised when determining who should be tested based on signs, symptoms, risk factors, and priority. (5)

slide.content: Suspect COVID-19 patients should undergo these specimen collection procedures. For upper respiratory tract testing, collect specimens with nasopharyngeal swab. Collect low respiratory tract specimens if possible. Sputum should be collected from patients with a productive cough. Patients with lower respiratory tract infection who are also on ventilator should get a bronchoalveolar lavage for testing. (5)
Healthcare workers even with mild symptoms should be tested and closely monitored if they are in contact with high risk COVID patients. (5)
